decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: Location Plan 21-028-E01, 21-028-E02, 21-028-E03, 21-028-E04, 21-028-E05, 21-028-E06, 21-028-E07, 21-028-E08, 21-028-E09, 21-028-E10, 21-028-P01, 21-028-P02, 21-028-P03, 21-028-P04, 21-028-P05, 21-028-P06, 21-028-P07, 21-028-P08, 21-028-P09, 21-028-P10.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A - F of Part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment to that order) no extensions, new windows or other alterations shall be carried out at the dwellinghouse hereby approved without the prior permission of the local planning authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site, to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the area, and in the interests of highway safety in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1, D4 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | All external materials to be used in the development shall be as specified on the approved elevation drawings and shall match the existing outbuilding as closely as possible.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7.4 and 7B; London Plan (2021) policy D3 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | The refuse storage area shown on the approved plans shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained unobstructed in perpetuity.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety all in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) and 6.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy SI7 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | The cycle storage area shown on the approved plans shall provide at least 2 long stay cycle parking spaces in accordance with policy and these shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate bicycle storage provision and in the interests of reducing congestion to the local transport network, in accordance with policies 1.1 (j) and 3.1(i) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy T5 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | The private amenity area shown on the approved plans shall be laid out prior to first occupation of the dwelling hereby permitted and retained in perpetuity thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision of amenity space within the site in accordance with London Plan Policy D6 and Policy 7D of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The site is within the worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (57/60 dB) (See Appendix 5 SPG10). Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted for approval by the Council in writing, for the sound insulation of the building envelope, based on the aircraft noise contour spectrum specified in Section 6 Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, and which will achieve the internal criteria for noise sensitive rooms. The details should also include the provision of alternative means of acoustically attenuated ventilation and cooling, as necessary, (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and low self-noise), in accordance with the Council's criteria. The works should be completed before occupation and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Prior to occupation of the dwelling hereby approved a timber fence 1.8m high shall be provided between the private amenity areas of the approved dwelling and the communal amenity area of No. 9 Charlbury Grove and this fencing shall be permanently retained.

Reason: To protect the residential amenity of residents of the dwellings and ensure adequate provision of private amenity space in accordance with policies 1.1 and 2.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | No operations shall commence on site until appropriate measures for protection of nearby existing trees have been implemented.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with policies G4, G5 and G7 of the London Plan, policy 5.10 of the Ealing Development Management DPD and the Ealing SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines. | Prior to occupation of the dwelling hereby approved the hard/soft landscape works and boundary treatments shown on the approved plans shall be implemented including planting of three new trees. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and amenity of prospective occupiers, and in accordance with policies G5 and G7 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(b) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
description: Renovation of existing outbuilding and single-storey side extension to create a 2-bedroom dwellinghouse with associated private amenity space, cycle parking and refuse storage
